value.title: Discovering data within Power BI and quickly EXPORT!
value.excerpt: Sometimes you just don't know what data is out there in Power BI. Patrick shows you how you can discover data available to you and also how to quickly export that data! Even with just a Pro account!  Data discovery using the data hub https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/connect-data/service-data-hub?tabs=datasets
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/eviMr_f_LQM" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Do we need more Power BI Premium Capacity?
value.excerpt: Capacity planning for Power BI Premium is not an exact science. How much capacity do you need? As with most things, it depends! Adam walks through some things to consider when thinking about your planning.  Premium Gen2 capacity load evaluation https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/admin/service-premium-concepts
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/ipdMRPdXcWA" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Does it matter where your Power BI reports are deployed?
value.excerpt: Where to deploy your Power BI Report? My Workspace? Regular Workspace? What about Apps? Adam breaks it down to help you make the right choice and understand why it matters!  ðŸ“¢ Become a member: https://guyinacu.be/membership   *******************  Want to take your Power BI skills to the next level?

value.title: Excel and OneDrive with Power BI For Collaboration
value.excerpt: In this 2 minute Tuesday, Patrick looks at how to use Excel and OneDrive with Power BI For Collaboration. Using this approach, you can easily keep Power BI updated when team members update an Excel spreadsheet hosted on OneDrive. This is a great alternative to using Google Sheets which can be painful

value.title: Expand lists in Power BI (also a look at M Syntax)
value.excerpt: I show how you can take a table that lists "Record" and expand that within Power BI. This also works with Power Query. I have a look at the M Syntax and show a cleaner approach.  SUBSCRIBE! https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCFp1vaKzpfvoGai0vE5VJ0w?sub_confirmation=1  LET'S CONNECT!  Guy in a Cube -- http://twitter.com/guyinacube

value.title: Filter Power BI reports using a URL query string
value.excerpt: In this video, I show you how to filter Power BI reports, within the Power BI service, using a URL query string.  This is actually documented here - https://powerbi.microsoft.com/en-us/documentation/powerbi-service-share-unshare-dashboard/#share-just-a-report  In addition to showing you how to filter

value.title: How Parameters work with the Power BI Paginated Visual
value.excerpt: Parameters for the Power BI Paginated visual can give you a lot of flexibility. Adam walks you through how to set up the parameters and breaks down what is actually happening with the values.  Create and use the paginated report visual https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/visuals/paginated-report-visual

value.title: How we optimize Power Query and Power BI Dataflows

value.title: Inside Power Query reference queries for Power BI and Excel
value.excerpt: Chris Webb joins Patrick to look at what happens when you use reference queries for Power Query. This applies to both Power BI and Excel. Chris also looks at how change the behavior to make things a bit faster.  Data Privacy Blog: https://blog.crossjoin.co.uk/2018/12/27/data-privacy-settings-data-refresh-performance-power-bi-excel/

value.title: Introducing Power BI Premium Per User (Preview)

value.title: Power BI parameters - Updating in the Power BI Service or with APIs
value.excerpt: In this video, Adam looks at how you can update Power BI parameters within the service or by using APIs. You can create Power BI Parameters within Power BI Desktop using Power Query. value.title: Power BI PowerShell and the Admin API
value.excerpt: The Power BI PowerShell and the Admin API allow you to quickly inventory your organization and manage workspaces and access.
